node.title: Stephen Sondheim dies aged 91
node.alt: Stephen Sondheim smiles towards the camera wearing a brown suit jacket
node.description: US musical theatre giant Stephen Sondheim, the composer and lyricist behind Broadway hits such as West Side Story, Into the Woods and Sweeney Todd,Â dies aged 91.
node.content: ["US musical theatre giant Stephen Sondheim, the composer and lyricist behind Broadway hits such as West Side Story, Into the Woods and Sweeney Todd,\u00a0has died aged 91.", "Sondheim, who helped American musical theatre evolve beyond pure entertainment and reach new artistic heights,\u00a0died early on Friday at his home in Roxbury, Connecticut,\u00a0the New York Times reported.", "His eight lifetime Tony Awards surpassed the total of any other composer.", "Sondheim learned\u00a0the art of musical theatre when he was just a teenager from The Sound of Music\u00a0lyricist Oscar Hammerstein II.", "Hamilton\u00a0creator Lin-Manuel Miranda, who was mentored by Sondheim, called him musical theatre's greatest lyricist.", "Sondheim's most successful musicals included Into the Woods,\u00a0which opened on Broadway in 1987 and used children's fairy tales to untangle adult obsessions, the 1979 thriller Sweeney Todd\u00a0about a murderous barber in London whose victims are served as meat pies, and 1962's A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum,\u00a0a vaudeville-style comedy set in ancient Rome.\u00a0", "\"I love the theatre\u00a0as much as music, and the whole idea of getting across to an audience and making them laugh, making them cry \u2014\u00a0just making them feel \u2014\u00a0is paramount to me,\" Sondheim said in a 2013 interview with National Public Radio.", "More to come.", "Reuters"]
